Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision denying refugee status based on credibility findings can be reviewed without a hearing transcript
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed refugee status as an Ahmadi sympathizer but was deemed not credible by the Board
Court_Ruling: Judicial review application allowed; case referred back for redetermination by a different panel
Defendant_Behavior: Board did not notify applicant of reasoning or allow response
Grounds_for_Claim: Credibility concerns, lack of procedural fairness
Legal_Standard: Judicial review requires sufficient record to assess credibility and procedural fairness
Assessment_Factor: Procedural fairness, notice, opportunity to respond
Procedural_Issue: Lack of notice under s. 68(5), absence of hearing transcript
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant found not credible by Board
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution as an Ahmadi sympathizer
Evidence_Assessed: Insufficient record due to missing transcript
Governing_Rule: Sufficient record required for judicial review of credibility and procedural fairness
Outcome: Case remanded for new hearing with proper procedures
Harm_Assessment: Denial of fair hearing and opportunity to respond
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed refugee status as an Ahmadi sympathizer but was deemed not credible by the Board
Evidence_Handling: Failure to provide transcript or record of hearing
Evidence_Assessment: Inability to assess credibility due to insufficient record
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of transcript preventing review of credibility and fairness
Legal_Standard_Applied: Procedural fairness and adequacy of record in judicial review
